description: A fast breakdown of Tax-Advantaged Accounts: 401(k) and IRA for builders.

hook.text: Your employer matches your 401(k) contributions 50 cents per dollar.

buildup.text: 401(k) and IRA accounts let investments grow tax-free or tax-deferred, accelerating compound growth.

discovery.text: Traditional 401(k): tax deduction now, taxed at withdrawal. Roth IRA: taxed now, tax-free withdrawals in retirement.

climax.text: Maxing out a 401(k) for 30 years at 10% returns creates over $1 million more than the same amount in a taxable account.

punchline.text: The government offers a tax break to help you retire. Take it.

quiz.question: What is the key difference between a Traditional 401(k) and a Roth IRA?
options: Traditional offers a tax break now; Roth offers tax-free withdrawals later
